Statistics¶

Some text here:

class deepatari.tools.Statistics(agent, net, mem, env, args, target_dir)[source]¶

This class handles all statistics of an experiment.

The class keeps the statistics running and saves certain paramaters at the end of an epoch to files. It’s also responsible for generating nice graphs to evaluate the training progress.

STATS_AGENT_TRAIN¶

tuple – Defines a tuple of all relevant agent training parameters for evaluation.

STATS_AGENT_TEST¶

tuple – Defines a tuple of all relevant agent testing parameters for evaluation.

STATS_AGENT_NET¶

tuple – Defines a tuple of all relevant network training parameters for evaluation.

name¶

str – The name of the statistic object.

agent¶

Agent – The agent that performes the learning.

net¶

Learner – Object of one of the Learner modules.

mem¶

Memory – The replay memory to save the experiences.

env¶

Environment – The envirnoment in which the agent actuates.

target_dir¶

str – Location to save the stats.

csv_file_train¶

file – The file were the training parameters are stored.

csv_writer_train¶

writer – Converts the data into a delimited string to save in the file.

csv_file_test¶

file – The file were the testing parameters are stored.

csv_writer_test¶

writer – Converts the data into a delimited string to save in the file.

time_start¶

time – Keeps track of the experiment start time.

phase¶

str – Indicates the current phase of the experiment.

close()[source]¶

Closes the logfiles after the experiment.

from_agent(reward, terminal, epsilon)[source]¶

Handles the callbacks from the agent.

Parameters:
  • reward (int) – The reward received after taking the action.
  • terminal (bool) – The new terminal state indicator after taking the action.
  • epsilon (float) – The current epsilon value.
from_learner(cost_batch, q_avg_batch)[source]¶

Handles the callbacks from the learner.

Parameters:
  • cost_batch (float) – Cost per batch.
  • q_avg_batch (float) – Average max Q-value per batch.
reset_epoch_stats()[source]¶

Resets the parameters to initial values for each epoch.

write_epoch_stats(epoch)[source]¶

Writes the stats for the current epoch to disk.

Parameters:epoch (int) – Current epoch.
